titleproper.value:
Guide to the Charles Laverty Papers
                    <num>AIA.074</num>

author.value: Finding aid prepared by Rachel Searcy

publisher.value: Tamiment Library and Robert F. Wagner Labor Archive

creation.value:
This finding aid was produced using the Archivists' Toolkit
                <date>2015-04-01T16:03-0400</date>

corpname.value: Tamiment Library and Robert F. Wagner Labor Archive

abstract.label: Abstract
abstract.value: Charles A. Laverty is a journalist and retired reserve member of the United States Army. He has been active in Irish republican circles and served as the President of the New York Irish History Roundtable. The majority of this collection consists of materials created and collected by Charles Laverty through the course of his travel and research intended for a biographical website of Irish Americans. In addition to the research files, the collection also includes photographs, ephemera, family materials, and materials documenting Laverty’s involvement in Clan na Gael and the Irish Brigade Association.

p.value: Identification of item, date; Charles Laverty Papers; AIA 074; box number; folder number; Archives of Irish America, Tamiment Library/Robert F. Wagner Labor Archives, New York University.
Donated by Charles Laverty in January 2015.

Charles A. Laverty (1930- ) is a journalist and retired reserve member of the United States Army. Born in 1930 in Moy, Co. Tyrone, Laverty emigrated to New York in 1948. He served in the US Army in Austria and Italy until 1952, after which he began his civilian career as a journalist on the financial desk of the 
                <emph render="italic">New York Journal American</emph>. Laverty has been active in Irish republican circles, including membership in Clan na Gael. He also served as the President of the New York Irish History Roundtable from 2003 until 2007.

The majority of this collection consists of materials created and collected by Charles Laverty through the course of his travel and research intended for a biographical website of Irish Americans. His primary areas of focus were indentured Irish in the American colonies, Irish and Irish Americans in the American Civil War, and members of the United Irishmen involved in the 1798 and 1803 rebellions who later emigrated to the United States. Much of this research material derives from rare 18th and 19th century books and periodicals. In addition to the research files, the collection also includes photographs, ephemera, family materials, and materials documenting Laverty’s involvement in Clan na Gael and the Irish Brigade Association.
